text: Cutting edge : TCR stimulation by antibody and bacterial superantigen induces <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation in human T cells .
Recent data show that TCR / CD3 stimulation induces activation of <extra_id_0> Stat5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in murine T cells .

Here , we show that CD3 ligation by mAb and Staphylococcal enterotoxin ( SE ) induce a rapid , gradually accumulating , long-lasting tyrosine , and serine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( but not <extra_id_0> Stat5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in allogen - specific human CD4+ T cell lines .
In contrast , <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces a rapid and transient tyrosine and serine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Compared with <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> CD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation induces a delayed <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> binding to oligonucleotide probes from the <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-2R alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter .

<extra_id_0> CD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated activation of <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is almost completely inhibited by a Src kinase inhibitor ( PP1 ) , whereas <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation is unaffected .

In conclusion , we show that <extra_id_0> CD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation by mAb and SE triggers a rapid , PP1 - sensitive tyrosine and serine phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in human CD4+ T cells .

Moreover , we provide evidence that TCR / CD3 and <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induce <extra_id_0> Stat3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation via distinct signaling pathways .
